item.title: Microsoft introduces ‘AI employees’ that can handle client queries
item.description:
US company gives customers the ability to build own virtual agents as well as releasing 10 off-the-shelf bots

Microsoft is introducing autonomous artificial intelligence agents, or virtual employees, that can perform tasks such as handling client queries and identifying sales leads, as the tech sector strives to show investors that the AI boom can produce indispensable products.

The US tech company is giving customers the ability to build their own AI agents as well as releasing 10 off-the-shelf bots that can carry out a range of roles including supply chain management and customer service.

Continue reading...

item.title: Get the Roku Streaming Stick 4K for 32% off — plus more Roku deals
item.description: Roku makes the best streaming devices we've tested and this week they're on sale. Shop Roku devices at Amazon for up to 32%.

item.title: We found several leftover robot vacuum deals from October Prime Day
item.description: This fall, get the smart mapping, self-emptying Eufy L60 for $299.99 or the mopping, self-drying Roborock Q Revo Pro for $749.99.

item.title: Tons of Beats earbuds and over-ear headphones are on sale at Amazon and Best Buy
item.description: As of Oct. 21, Amazon and Best Buy are offering discounts of up to $100 off select Beats earbuds and headphones.
